dependencies: Existing CSS custom properties and glass-morphism theme
Intersection Observer API for fade-in animations
Existing responsive breakpoints and mobile navigation
risks: Video file size (16MB) may impact page load performance
Mobile video playback compatibility across different browsers
Video aspect ratio and sizing on different screen sizes
Potential layout shift during video loading

detailed_analysis.feasibility_rationale: Very high feasibility due to: (1) Video file already exists in static/videos/, (2) Well-structured codebase with clear section patterns, (3) Existing CSS custom properties and glass-morphism styling system, (4) Standard HTML5 video implementation required, (5) Clear insertion point identified between experience and contact sections
detailed_analysis.complexity_rationale: Low complexity because: (1) Standard HTML5 video element implementation, (2) Existing CSS patterns can be reused, (3) No complex JavaScript interactions required beyond basic play/pause, (4) Responsive design patterns already established, (5) Fade-in animations already implemented via IntersectionObserver

implementation_approach.html_changes: Add new video section with container, section-title, and video element between lines 207-210 in index.html
implementation_approach.css_changes: Create .video-section class following existing section patterns, add video-specific styling with glass-morphism effects, ensure responsive behavior
implementation_approach.javascript_changes: Optional: Add video section to scroll animations, implement custom play/pause controls if needed, add loading states

design_considerations.styling_consistency: Use existing CSS custom properties (--primary, --bg-secondary, --spacing-xl, etc.)
design_considerations.responsive_design: Follow existing mobile-first approach with appropriate breakpoints
design_considerations.performance: Consider lazy loading, video preload settings, and mobile optimization
design_considerations.accessibility: Ensure proper video controls, keyboard navigation, and screen reader support

potential_challenges.video_sizing: Need to balance video visibility with 'not too large' requirement for non-HD quality
potential_challenges.mobile_performance: 16MB video file may impact mobile users with slower connections
potential_challenges.browser_compatibility: Ensure .mov format works across all target browsers (may need additional formats)
potential_challenges.layout_integration: Maintain existing section spacing and visual hierarchy

2. Implement CSS styling matching existing design system
